headline: Buche de Noel
description: Buche de Noel is a jelly-roll style chocolate cake with chocolate cream that's decorated to look like a yule log for an incredibly delicious Christmas dessert!

video.description: In this video, Nicole shows you how to bake the festive Buche de Noel that is typically served around Christmastime and is made to look like the seasonal yule log.
video.name: How to Make Buche de Noel

name: Buche de Noel

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Line a 10x15 inch jellyroll pan with parchment paper. In a large bowl, whip cream, 1/2 cup confectioners' sugar, 1/2 cup cocoa, and 1 teaspoon vanilla until thick and stiff. Refrigerate.
In a large bowl, use an electric mixer to beat egg yolks with 1/2 cup sugar until pale in color, light and frothy. Blend in 1/3 cup cocoa, 1 1/2 teaspoons vanilla, and salt.
In large glass bowl, using clean beaters, whip egg whites to soft peaks. Gradually add 1/4 cup sugar, and beat until whites form stiff peaks.
Immediately fold the yolk mixture into the whites.
Spread the batter evenly into the prepared pan.
Bake for 12 to 15 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the cake springs back when lightly touched.
Dust a clean dishtowel with confectioners' sugar. Run a knife around the edge of the pan, and turn the warm cake out onto the towel. Remove and discard parchment paper.
Starting at the short edge of the cake, roll the cake up with the towel. Cool for 30 minutes.
Unroll the cake, and spread the filling to within 1 inch of the edge.
Roll the cake up with the filling inside. Place seam side down onto a serving plate, and refrigerate until serving.

review.reviewBody: I had never made a Buche de Noel before, and this was pretty tasty! For me, it was too much dark chocolate, but my husband and a few others who are chocolate fanatics just loved it, so it was a success at Christmas! I used some Rosemary sprigs along the "logs" (I made 2) as a decoration and it looked very festive. I felt they stuck to the parchment paper, and it did not turn out even like the video. I have made other rolls before (pumpkin roll), and it's always turned out even. The eggs seemed to make it rise out of control! When it settled back down, it was better, but not even all over. I will try this again, because it's challenging and tasted very good!
First time making a log cake. My cake did not rise as thick as the video. Not sure what I would do differently. As a result I had way too much filling but in the end it was a yummy mess!
I wont be making this again. Like fluff air no flavor

This is less of a cake and more of a thin piece of bread covered in pudding. I've made many Yule Logs throughout the years using different recipes, but I will not be using this one again. The cake itself is incredibly thin, with little flavor, and the filling far too runny. It's still servable, but I definitely wouldn't recommend it. Not trying to make this review overly harsh, but let me put it this way- in my almost ten years of being an avid baker, this is the first time I've been compelled to write a bad review.

I tried this for a gluten free friend and made a flour one for the rest of us…hands down this is THE BEST I’ve ever made. So much so that we are invited to a holiday party each year with the caveat that I have to bring this.
I love it this the best recipe for Bûche de Noêl

This tasted wonderful! My nieces gobbled it right up!
I did have problems with the cake cracking and my fingers gouged the cake while I was transferring it to a platter. Not sure what the cure for this is but I was able to roll the imperfections to the bottom/sides and then I sprinkled the top with shaved chocolate and powdered sugar. No one was the wiser and it looked beautiful plated and of course tasted wonderful - not too sweet. Next time, I will try baking it longer (the center was very poufed), and possibly letting it cool a bit longer before inverting. Another option is to roll it loosely instead. I rolled it kind of tight and immediately after taking it from the oven.

I made the buche with 1 less yolk (6 egg whites + 5 yolks), added 1 tbsp of organic tapioca flour for a softer, easier to roll/unroll/ re-roll cake. Also substituted the sugar with 1/4 cup full monk fruit sweetener. Made and served partly on Christmas day, still soft and yummy 5 days later.
This is now my go to holiday cake! Rich and creamy, it was loved by all!
Thank you for continuing to use my photo for this recipe. Here's this year's 2021 Bouche de Noel. Due to covid, I only had limited resources for decoration.
Loved it as is!

TOTAL NIGHTMARE!!! The recipe called for “heavy cream”. The problem with this is that heavy cream is different in the US,Australia, the UK, Canada etc. Where I live, heavy cream is anything above 14% MF, so I used 18%MF. Well what a drippy horrible mess! The recipe should have called for “whipping cream” or “ 33%MF +”. As well, like a lot of people said, my cake turned out terribly. It would not roll. See the picture. I do not recommend this recipe even if you use whipping cream. Definitely use a different recipe which is what I’m going to do next time! Waste of time. We did have a great laugh though.... :)
My simply decorated cake had great taste and texture. I followed the recipe as written and it was easy to prepare. Will make again anytime of the year.

My 9-year old daughter and I - neither of us very experienced bakers - made this over the holidays and were quite pleased with the final result! We followed the video and the written directions and found it pretty straightforward. We made one modification - we added fine coconut and mini chocolate chips to the mousse-like filling - made it extra yummy and gave it a bit more texture. Coming out of the oven, the cake did stick to the parchment paper, resulting in some severe cracks in the roll. Not sure what we should have done differently. We did put a bit of shortening on the parchment paper to avoid just that, but were sadly unsuccessful. We decided to put some melted chocolate to cover up the mess - and I think it actually turned out even better! (We just melted chocolate chips with a bit of shortening.) It created a super tasty shell over the cake, giving it a more log-like appearance. We had a distanced gathering with neighbors in the backyard to share our creation and it was an all-round huge hit! will definitely try this again!
Great recipe - we got rave reviews on this delightful treat
Awesome.. Don't forget to grease th parchment paper.

This was my first time making a buche de Noel cake and it was not only delicious but beautiful! I had seen many other recipes that require frosting and didn’t realize that this one gets its bark aesthetic from the powdered sugar that is sprinkled on the towel when rolling the cake. I love that this recipe doesn’t require the extra frosting. A new tradition for our family - thank you!
Made this as a new dish for our holiday gathering. LOVED it! The chocolate cream is so light, fluffy and delicious. Didn't change a thing. Will certainly make it again.

The cake is fabulous - as others have said, just make sure to beat the heck out of the yolks! I used the top setting on my mixer for 5-6 minutes. The cake needs the loft that extra air will give. The baking timing is right on - don't leave it in too long. Wrapping in a silicone sheet, then carefully scraping along the back with a spatula when unrolling it, was key. Used the ganache recipe from this site for filling and frosting, then a very cool technique for the bark: spread a thin layer of melted chocolate over a piece of parchment paper, roll it up tightly (doesn't matter what direction), refrigerate til solid, then unroll. The chocolate will break into shards. Work quickly adding it to the ganache frosting - your finger temp will melt the chocolate. Then meringue mushrooms were added. The marzipan snail is my daughter's fabulous addition. 
I'll never use another cake recipe for our buche. This is great!!

This was an excellent recipe! Like others, I sprayed the parchment paper and beat the eggs for a long time, but basically followed it exactly. My familyI liked it so much that I tried modifying for a non-chocolate version today

Loved this recipe. Made this with my daughter who had just learned about a buche de Noel. Made the recipe as written and it was delicious. Easy to make too! We will be adding this to our annual holiday desserts.
Very easy to make, delicious and looks impressive!

This recipe worked wonderfully for me. I didn’t change a thing. The best part is how light it is. I don’t usually even like cake very much- too sweet, too heavy. But this one, flourless and with a whipped cream

I was thrilled with how this turned out, although it wasn't how I expected. As you can see the cake was very thin. My oven runs hot, so I took it out after 10 minutes but it may have been slightly under, which might be why it collapsed so much. Fortunately, I used all the filling, which made it turn out big enough. Other reviews say there is plenty of filling to do the outside, but I think you need to use it all inside. I followed the directions, including reviewer suggestions to beat the yolks for 5+ minutes. I melted some chocolate chips with cream to very loosely paint the outside to create the bark look. It was light and delicious and I would definitely make it again as it looked fantastic!

It was easy to do, and tastes amazing, and looks beautiful. Can't wait to amaze my family and friends today at the end of our beautiful Christmas dinner. What I love the most about this is that the filling is not too sweet so my husband will love it. He hates really sweet desserts.
I made it according to the recipe, plus a few tips from others. Everything on it is edible!

I try to make this exact recipe every year. My 93 year old mother in law with dementia had this in France as a child, and if love to be able to create this for her. I consider myself to be an experienced baker, but even still this recipe is HARD! I cannot get the cake to peel away from the parchment without breaking into a million pieces. Last year I was able to pull it off but then it stuck to the dish rag. I wish I knew where I was going wrong!

I have been making this for over 15 years. My daughter wants to make one this year, passing the recipe on to new generation. It is rich, so I make thin slices. Yes to greasing the pan and the parchment. We love it.

Looks beautiful!. Is there a way to find out how to make the bark, mushrooms, and holly on top! when clicking on the recipe, it is for the cake and the decoration is the best that I have seen. Thanks so much. Jill
great recipe !! i also followed the reviewer tips of greasing the parchment paper and fluffing the whites for 5 minutes on high. it turned out perfect !

Obsessed with this cake! It was my first time making a Buche de Noel/Yule Log Cake and it was so much fun! It turned out way better than expected! I followed the reviews and made sure to beat the egg yolks until very, very white and made sure to beat the egg whites until they were stiff enough to stand on a spatula/not fall off. I forgot to spray the parchment, but it ended up coming off the cake fine. This is going to be a Christmas tradition going forward!

I don’t recommend it. I just tried it and nothing cooked correctly. It might have been my location, , but all of the measurements were off. There was not enough cake, too much filling, and it’s not tasty.
This recipe is easy and delicious. The cake is so light! There is no need for icing on the top, just dust with powdered sugar. I recommend making it a day in advance so it can set in the fridge.

Excellent recipe with the right amount of sweet offset by cocoa bitterness. I used it to create the airplane "fuselage" for a birthday jumbo jet cake. I can see myself using the same batter and filling recipe to shape as a bouche, or turned into a round or square cake with 3 layers (with different baking times and potentially scaling up the recipe by 25-50% for that purpose)
Yes, I've been baking it for 40+years and still love it, sue
Awesome! The kids and I made this for Christmas. It was excellent.
Need to bake MUCH longer than the recommended 12-15 min. I cooked it for 18 and it was still under done

This was an amazing yule log. No one at the table could discern that it was GF. I made it as described with exception of the cream filling. I made it as suggested by AllRecipes, as detailed in their magazine. The result was a beautiful velvety chocolate "cake" and a not too sweet filling that wonderfully complemented each other. I will make this again and again.
Was a hit

This was a beautiful addition to our Christmas table! Very easy and the mixer does all the work of whipping egg yolks and whites! I was worried it would be heavy but it was anything but. I only gave 4 stars because the recipe- as written- doesn’t include the tips that make the recipe successful. 
I followed other reviewers’ advice and made sure to beat egg yolks for 5+ mins, the same for the whites. I lined the pan with parchment and greased it. The cake rose a bit while baking but- like a soufflé, which it pretty much is- it ended up falling when it came out. I hoped it would keep some of that volume, but it didn’t. It was flatter than I expected. 
The whipped cream frosting made about 2x more than you need for this recipe. I frosted the outside with it, too, and still had a ton leftover. I’d cut that in half next time. 
The cake itself is pretty low calorie, compared to others. It didn’t have any oil or butter and had a small amount of sugar. The bulk of the calories come from the icing, which is light and fluffy and not too sweet.
I decorated with sugared rosemary and cranberries, and some chocolate curls.

This turned out better than I expected. It was delicious! I think my sponge cake may have fallen a little flat but since I’ve never had this dessert before I can’t be sure. Overall pretty easy to do, I sprayed parchment paper really well, was very liberal on the powdered sugar on the tea towel. I followed the tip to beat the yolks & sugar 5 minutes, took cake out of pan after 5 minutes. 

I used Christmas picks to decorate, I hate meringue so didn’t want to do the mushrooms. Also found some candy snow flakes at the store & used those as well. Powder sugar on top. Very pretty, flavor was amazing. Love the whipped cream frosting which I will use on other cakes. Overall I’m really happy! Oh & ignore the toothpicks in the cake pic, I was using to hold foil off the frosting & forgot to take them out.
Delicious and so light! Great recipe, my family ate the whole cake on Christmas eve. Yes, beat the eggs for 5 minutes, very important for any type of cakes rolls.
Made it... lots of fun and turned out very cool... can’t wait to snack on it

This turned out amazing, no issues rolling it at all! We sliced the end off and used it as a little extra appendage. We also used only half the whipped cream inside the log, then used the rest of it to decorate the outside. We used a fork to create the bark pattern. Our family was so impressed!!!
Followed the tips of beating the egg yolks super long and let it cool before flipping it over - plus sprayed the parchment paper w PAM before adding the “batter”
I’ve made this about 4 times now and every time it has been beautiful and delicious. It’s our new Christmas dessert tradition. I follow the instructions to the T and it’s perfect every time!

A great recipe! I made it exactly as it directed me to and the outcome was superb! I added some chocolate bark look on top by melting chocolate chips and spreading thin on wax paper- freezing- then pasting on the top with a little filling.
We love it and have made it for the last four years as a new annual tradition. The only change would be to coat the parchment paper to discourage sticking.
This was a wonderful recipe I could make as a special Christmas treat for my little niece with celiac disease. I did a practice run this week and it turned out great!
I make for Christmas menu is very nice recipe ..i love it . Thank you

This cake is a family tradition at this point and is a favorite at our Christmas gatherings. The only drawback is that it's so delicious there's never a crumb left. It always brings back sweet memories of our time living in France and the beautiful bouche de noel's in the windows of the bakeries at Christmas. It's authentic and the recipe is a homerun. I do not do more than sprinkle powdered sugar on top instead of frosting and garnish the plate with fresh raspberries or cranberries and perhaps rosemary. Frosting is not needed for flavor since the filling is so creamy and rich. Joyeux Noel et Bon Appetit!

It looks and tastes very good. Not like the picture but I am not a pro. The recipe was difficult to follow as it is very undescriptive. There was far too much filling that came out. But let's be honest, who doesn't want more frosting.

This was the best tasting dessert I've ever made. 
Like suggested I whipped the bejesus outta them things and my cake was light and fluffy.
Fun recipe. MUCH easier than I expected it to be. Guests were super impressed.
Turned out beautifully for a first try. The only mistake I made was overfilling with the cream, which was delicious, but affected the spiral. Great tasting recipe!
No changes. It was a showstopper.

So so so good. I want to eat the whole thing myself. The recipe makes almost twice as much filling as needed, but I don't consider that a problem! I'm also used to pouring chocolate ganache over the top but this recipe is so rich you don't need it at all - the powdered sugar is enough. I will definitely be making this again.

This is an outstanding cake. Its light, flavorful, and not very difficult to make. It just takes time and patience. Made this for Christmas and it was a great hit. I will certainly make this again and encourage all to give it a try. Its really not that hard as long as you roll the cake up while its warm and then let it thoroughly cool before unrolling and filling with the delicious chocolate mousse filling. Used the extra filling for piping on the outside of the cake and it was so pretty!
DELICIOUS! Pretty easy but you need to eat it that night

I am not a skilled baker, but this worked well! I made sure to beat the eggs for a long time and my cake was nice and light/had a good rise. I think this would taste great with some variations of the extract flavor!
I would prefer a richer chocolate flavor cake. Also my cake cracked and flattened as I removed it from the pan and rolled it. Was good but I expected a denser cake.
Great recipe! Followed the steps exact.y and got a great cake. The cake is on the bitter side, so most people did not eat a lot. In the future, I will use sweetened cocoa for the inside icing.

It turned out very good IF you don't hold back on the whipping. Especially on the egg yokes, make sure you whip them until they are so pale they're almost white. There are no rising agents in this recipe so it's very important if you want to prevent it from turning out as a chocolate omelet with whipped cream.

This turned out amazing. Rave reviews from everyone. I made "bark" from melted, hardened chocolate and some meringue mushrooms from recipe on this site. Also made sugared cranberries and used some fresh greens from a fir tree in my yard. Sadly I forgot to sprinkle the powdered sugar over it before serving but no one noticed. Will add picture later.
Lots of careful work - but my standup mixer make it so much easier. Big hit at holiday dinner
Very good recipe! Easy to follow! Definitely need to spray the paper with Pam. Otherwise the recipe is complete.

It's a beautiful cake. I doubled the recipe and incorporated all of the feedback from other reviewers--beat the egg yolks for 5 minutes and used a significant amount to icing sugar on the dish clothe. Other changes: 1. I used plain whipping cream fill because I did't want to be overloaded with chocolate and 2. I didn't use all of the fill (cutting it by 1/4) because I didn't want it too sloppy. I topped it with chocolate butter cream frosting, chocolate bark flakes and meringue mushrooms and it was just lovely.

I find it confusing that it doesn't say what to do with the first bowl. I suppose I'm supposed to assume that's the filling? I'm using Swiss meringue buttercream for my filling. I'm glad I didn't waste ingredients.

Oh my gosh... to die for. Absolutely delicious. It is pretty to look at as well when the dish is completed. Its a very rich but also a very light dessert. Perfect for after dinner with a nice cup of coffee or hot chocolate.

It came out great although I was very concerned when I looked in oven and saw that batter was growing rapidl a half way through the cooking! When I took out from oven batter came down. The final piece is fantastic !
I will it again next Christmas.
They didn’t put you’re supposed to mix the egg yolks and whites together. They skipped that step in the video. Otherwise it was great!
every one loved it and I am defiantly making again this year
This was very good. It was not too sweet, the mocha was excellent. everyone loved it and will be doing it again.

Followed the recipe to the T, as well as the comments about whipping all the eggs good, chilling the cream, spraying the parchment paper. It's one of the best deserts that I've made, and it's flourless! Making it again for Christmas!

this was a terrible recipe tried to make for my family and tasted like burnt chocolate cake followed the recipe exactly no substitutions and i did not half or double the recipe do not make for important events !
This was much easier than I thought it would be to make. It turned out perfectly following the recipe as it is.
It completely failed for me. I couldn't even detatch it from the parchment paper
First time making this. Next time I will likely use less whipped cream filling (maybe 25% less) on the inside and save some for the outside. The cake was rich and light without being sweet.
If you follow all of the recommendations from other viewers, this will turn out beautifully. We made it for my daughters French class and it is sure to be a hit
Followed the recipe exactly, it was super easy and turned out really great! The only thing I would do, would be to add frosting and make a little less filling. Really great though!
I didnt make any changes its tastes great will definatly make it again
The cake is okay, not great, and I am disappointed it did not come with instructions for decorating it as per the picture.

I've made this recipe at least once a year for the last 9 years. My mom's birthday is December 18 and she perfers this over any birthday cake. 

When making this dessert remember that the more air you put into the ingredients the better the batter and icing will be. So mix mix mix!!!
WonderFul for Christmas all dressed up with mushrooms or just a great desert for family and /or company
This Yule Log was delicious. It's light & airy. I had never made a flourless cake, but I made sure to beat the eggs until very fluffy & it turned out great!

I loved this Yule Log. It was so light and airy that it simply melted in your mouth. I had never made a flourless cake, so I made sure to let the mixer beat the eggs for a couple of minutes until they were completely pale, since I read that was the key. Overall, my family enjoyed it. I will be making this again!

I liked the cake, the Icing/filling stuff could be better though. I didn't have parchment paper and I'm impatient so I just used Crisco. Don't use Crisco in this recipe. Only half the cake came out of the pan. Then it fell apart. Otherwise It was GREAT!!! Warning: ALWAYS USE PARCHMENT PAPER!!!!!!!!
Fabulous recipe and final product!!
I made this as an amateur baker and it came out great! My family was so impressed and thought it was very professional. It looked and tasted amazing!!
I made this for a French class and it was amazing! Takes some time and practice but it’s very good!

Love this recipe! It was so easy that I ended up making two! One for my family and one for my in-laws. Everyone said I put in way too much work. For the "bark" I melted some chocolate chips and then placed it on wax paper and rolled it around my rolling pin until it hardened. When I unrolled it they crumbled off into a nice bark which I scored with a toothpick. I also made mushrooms out of fondant and dipped them in cocoa powder for "dirt" The cakes came out beautiful and I plan on making them every year now.

We have made this recipe 2 Christmases in a row. It’s incredible! I’m a French teacher and so excited to make this a family tradition. We usually add chocolate buttercream frosting to decorate on the outside as well as powdered sugar, chocolate shaving (grated chocolate bar) and red berries. The hardest part is taking the cake off of the parchment paper and then rolling it without having it break or crack, so watch out for that!

It was easier than it looked, and I followed every single tip that previous reviewers provided, like setting up the ingredients first; spraying the parchment with non-stick spray; I even greased the pan UNDER the parchment; beating the egg yolks to death (as in Texas - BTHO) making sure they are PALE yellow; beat the egg whites sufficiently; heavily, heavily, heavily dust the towel with powdered sugar; look at it after 12 minutes because you almost certainly want to take it out then instead of waiting for the full 15 minutes. It was chocolate-y, delicious, not too sweet, very rich, and we loved it!!!!!
Loved it! I thought it was very simple and tasted amazing (The frosting/ filling honestly tastes like a Wendy's frosty!) Will definitely make again

I only used a quarter of a cup of cocoa in the whipped cream and it worked great. Save about 1/4 the cream filling for the “frosting” on the outside . Also I saved a big step by just using the parchment to roll it up. I had brushed melted butter on the pan and then on the parchment. I left the cake in the pan to cool for about 20 minutes then rolled it and let it sit for about an hour. I then unrolled it, filled it, and rolled it up again right off the parchment. A few chocolate shavings and icing sugar and it was done.

So easy to make!! I followed reviews and beat eggs until very pale. I refrigerated it overnight, it was perfect. I made the mushrooms out of fondant and made "bark" out of some melted chocolate chips, vegetable oil, and creme de mint. My family could not stop talking about it, and ate the entire thing!!

First time making anything like this and it turned out so amazing that I made another one and it turned out just as great! Thank you so much! My family can't get enough however my daughter is gluten free but doesn't like chocolate so I may try this vanilla and spread some fruit preserves and then the cream filling. We will see how it works out.

Incredible!!! Follow the others advice to beat the yolks for five minutes and it turned out light and fluffy and delicious! I made the bark by spreading a small thin layer of chocolate bark on parchment paper then loosely rolling it up and putting in the refrigerator and when it unravels it breaks into little pieces which I attached to the log with more melted chocolate. I also made this with the meringue mushrooms. Rave reviews!
This was my first attempt at this type of dessert. It has definitely become one I'll be making every Christmas. Super easy. I frosted mine with chocolate icing and everyone loved it.
